text: Robert Leslie Cooke (16 February 1957 – August 2021) was an English footballer and manager. Cooke played as a forward in the Football League. He played for Peterborough United and Brentford. He managed Warboys Town and later became a scout. == Career statistics == Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League FA Cup League Cup Other Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Peterborough United 1980–81 Fourth Division 46 22 6 4 4 3 — 56 29 1981–82 46 24 3 3 2 1 4Appearances in Football League Group Cup 3 55 31 1982–83 22 5 4 2 3 3 43 appearances and 1 goal in Football League Trophy, 1 appearance in Northamptonshire Cup 1 33 11 Total 114 51 13 9 9 7 8 4 144 71 Brentford 1984–85 Third Division 24 12 — — 7Appearances in Football League Trophy 4 31 16 1985–86 44 17 1 0 4 1 2 0 51 18 1986–87 40 20 3 0 2 1 3 4 48 25 1987–88 16 4 1 0 2 1 1 0 20 5 Total 124 53 5 0 8 3 13 8 150 64 Millwall 1987–88 Second Division 4 1 — — 1Appearance in Full Members Cup 0 5 1 Career total 242 105 18 9 17 10 22 12 299 136 == Honours == Grantham * Southern League First Division North: 1978–79 Northampton Spencer * United Counties League Premier Division: 1991–92 Individual *Grantham Supporters' Player of the Year: 1978–79 *Football League Fourth Division PFA Team of the Year: 1980–81 ==References== Category:1957 births Category:2021 deaths Category:English football managers Category:English footballers Category:Brentford F.C. players Category:Luton Town F.C. players Category:Sportspeople from Yorkshire
